summary: I dreamt that there was a remake of Avengers: Infinity War, but all the characters were played by Jester and Fjord. They...
body:
I dreamt that there was a remake of Avengers: Infinity War, but all the characters were played by Jester and Fjord. They couldn’t decide which one of them would be Thanos because neither of them were purple, so they compromised by having Jester sit on Fjord’s shoulders.

I woke up before I could see them actually act.

Pity.

reblog.comment:
I dreamt that there was a remake of Avengers: Infinity War, but all the characters were played by Jester and Fjord. They couldn’t decide which one of them would be Thanos because neither of them were purple, so they compromised by having Jester sit on Fjord’s shoulders.

I woke up before I could see them actually act.

Pity.

trail.content_raw:
I dreamt that there was a remake of Avengers: Infinity War, but all the characters were played by Jester and Fjord. They couldn’t decide which one of them would be Thanos because neither of them were purple, so they compromised by having Jester sit on Fjord’s shoulders.

I woke up before I could see them actually act.

Pity.
trail.content:
I dreamt that there was a remake of Avengers: Infinity War, but all the characters were played by Jester and Fjord. They couldn’t decide which one of them would be Thanos because neither of them were purple, so they compromised by having Jester sit on Fjord’s shoulders.

I woke up before I could see them actually act.

Pity.

tags: my experience of bingo halls is accurate and common right?
summary: I've just realised that although it's obviously meant to be a pop culture reference, the fact that Caleb says 'that's a bingo'...
body:
I’ve just realised that although it’s obviously meant to be a pop culture reference, the fact that Caleb says ‘that’s a bingo’ in the correct context and Fjord corrects him strongly implies that not only does bingo exist as something recognisable to us, it’s also an acknowledged as a widespread cultural phenomenon

Essentially what I’m saying is that somewhere in the CR universe I would imagine there being a massive featureless fantasy-esque hall laid out with scratchy-ass carpeting filled with hundreds of people sitting quietly at a bunch of tables whilst a bored announcer tediously announces 'two fat ladies, eighty eight’, and at some point some random old biddy leaps out her chair screeching 'BINGO’ followed by 'GIVE ME MY FUCKING MONEY’

reblog.comment:

I’ve just realised that although it’s obviously meant to be a pop culture reference, the fact that Caleb says ‘that’s a bingo’ in the correct context and Fjord corrects him strongly implies that not only does bingo exist as something recognisable to us, it’s also an acknowledged as a widespread cultural phenomenon

Essentially what I’m saying is that somewhere in the CR universe I would imagine there being a massive featureless fantasy-esque hall laid out with scratchy-ass carpeting filled with hundreds of people sitting quietly at a bunch of tables whilst a bored announcer tediously announces 'two fat ladies, eighty eight’, and at some point some random old biddy leaps out her chair screeching 'BINGO’ followed by 'GIVE ME MY FUCKING MONEY’
trail.content:
I’ve just realised that although it’s obviously meant to be a pop culture reference, the fact that Caleb says ‘that’s a bingo’ in the correct context and Fjord corrects him strongly implies that not only does bingo exist as something recognisable to us, it’s also an acknowledged as a widespread cultural phenomenon

Essentially what I’m saying is that somewhere in the CR universe I would imagine there being a massive featureless fantasy-esque hall laid out with scratchy-ass carpeting filled with hundreds of people sitting quietly at a bunch of tables whilst a bored announcer tediously announces 'two fat ladies, eighty eight’, and at some point some random old biddy leaps out her chair screeching 'BINGO’ followed by 'GIVE ME MY FUCKING MONEY’

blog.name: myloish
blog.title: 🕊
blog.description: i wish the brush could lift the artist ↬ Mylo, 26

summary: extremely often while listening to campaign 2 stuff, my mind will wander to “i wonder what keyleth’s doin right now, or vex, or...
body:
extremely often while listening to campaign 2 stuff, my mind will wander to “i wonder what keyleth’s doin right now, or vex, or grog,” and now i’m kind of excited to be back in time and know that out there there’s a lonely firbolg sipping tea in his a tower, or a leetle blue tiefling locked behind the door at the lavish chateau… a young caleb, still in the care of his parents…

okay i hurt my own feelings again so moving on i’m also extremely excited to see what chaos these power-drunk level 20 bastards are gonna do to a city or a person, and how some poor decision making will no doubt follow them into the second campaign as well

okay i hurt my own feelings again so moving on i’m also extremely excited to see what chaos these power-drunk level 20 bastards are gonna do to a city or a person, and how some poor decision making will no doubt follow them into the second campaign as well

okay i hurt my own feelings again so moving on i’m also extremely excited to see what chaos these power-drunk level 20 bastards are gonna do to a city or a person, and how some poor decision making will no doubt follow them into the second campaign as well

blog.name: crtranscript
blog.title: Critical Role Transcript
blog.description: A #Critter project to add captions to every episode of Critical Role.

summary: [image description: Screenshot of a map of Emon from The Story of Vox Machina video. Text at the top reads "SO MANY LANGUAGES!"...
caption:
[image description: Screenshot of a map of Emon from The Story of Vox Machina video. Text at the top reads “SO MANY LANGUAGES!” with translated closed captions beneath.]

Did you know that The Story of Vox Machina has been translated into Chinese (simplified AND traditional), French, Italian, Polish, Portuguese, and Swedish? IT’S TRUE. Add another language with CR_Translate!
